Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. params._address: Address to add to the whitelist.
Address for assigning the freezer role.
Address for assigning the limiter role.
Address for assigning the super admin role.
Address for assigning the transporter role.
Address for assigning the voter role.
Address for assigning the whitelister role.

params._amount: Amount of tokens to set as the allowance.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

params._amount: Amount of tokens to burn. Calling conditions: - balance of `_account` must be grater or equal than `_amount`.

params._subtractedValue: Value to substruct from the allowance for the `_spender`.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Requirements: - result of substruction must be greater or equal to 0.

params._account: Account at which to freeze funds.
Account to get amount allowed to transfer today.
Account to get amount allowed to transfer today.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._addedValue: Value to add to the allowance for the `_spender`.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

params._address: Address for checking.
Address for checking.
Address for checking.
Address for checking.
Address for checking.
Address to check in the whitelist.

returns._0: Is the address in the whitelist.

params._address: Address for checking.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._address: Address to remove from the whitelist.
Address for removing the freezer role.
Address for removing the limiter role.
Address for removing the transporter role.
Address for removing the voter role.
Address for removing the whitelister role.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._account: Address where to set transaction count limit.
Address where to set transfer limit.

splitOrMerge(uint256,uint256).details: 1-2: one share turns into two. 3-2: three shares turns into two. Requirements: - `_x` must not be equal to `_y`. - `_x` and `_y` must be greater than 0.

params._x: The count of shares before split.
params._y: The count of shares after split.

params._value: Flag that enables or disables the transactions limit.
Flag that enables or disables the whitelist.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Requirements: - `_amount` must be less or equal allowance for the `_sender`.

params._amount: Amount to transfer. Requirements: - balance of `_from` must be greater or equal to `_amount`.
params._from: Address from which to transfer funds.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._account: Account at which to unfreeze funds.

addAddressToWhitelist(address).notice: Add an address to the whitelist.

addFreezer(address).notice: Add the freezer role for the address.

addLimiter(address).notice: Add the limiter role for the address.

addSuperAdmin(address).notice: Add the super admin role for the address.

addTransporter(address).notice: Add the transporter role for the address.

addVoter(address).notice: Add the voter role for the address.

addWhitelister(address).notice: Add the whitelister role for the address.

allowance(address,address).notice: the remaining number of tokens that `_spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `_owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Sets `_amount` as the allowance of `_spender` over the caller's tokens. Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns the amount of tokens owned by `_account`.

burn(address,uint256).notice: Burning of tokens from the address.

methods.constructor: STBXToken simply implements a ERC20 token.

decimals().notice: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation.

freezeFunds(address).notice: Freeze all funds at the address.

getAllowedToTransfer(address).notice: Get the number of tokens that can be transferred today by `_account`. Can be 0 in 2 cases: a) `_updateTransferLimit` function not called yet; b) transfer limit was set to 0 by limiter.

getLeftTransactionCountLimit(address).notice: Get the number of transactions that can be transferred today by `_account`. Can be 0 in 2 cases: a) `_updateTransferLimit` function not called yet; b) transfer limit was set to 0 by limiter.

getTransactionCountLimit(address).notice: Returns transaction count limit for `_account`. Can be default value or personally assigned to the `_account` value.

getTransferLimit(address).notice: Returns transfer limit for `_account`. Can be defaul value or personally assigned to the `_account` value.

isFreezer(address).notice: Checks if the address is assigned the freezer role.

isFrozenFunds(address).notice: Checking if the funds are frozen.

isLimiter(address).notice: Checks if the address is assigned the limiter role.

isSuperAdmin(address).notice: Checks if the address is assigned the super admin role.

isTransporter(address).notice: Checks if the address is assigned the transporter role.

isVoter(address).notice: Checks if the address is assigned the voter role.

isWhitelistedAddress(address).notice: Checking if the address is whitelisted.

isWhitelister(address).notice: Checks if the address is assigned the whitelister role.

mint(address,uint256).notice: Minting of new tokens to the address.

name().notice: Returns the name of the token.

removeAddressFromWhitelist(address).notice: Remove an address from the whitelist.

removeFreezer(address).notice: Remove the freezer role for the address.

removeLimiter(address).notice: Remove the limiter role for the address.

removeTransporter(address).notice: Remove the transporter role for the address.

removeVoter(address).notice: Remove the voter role for the address.

removeWhitelister(address).notice: Remove the whitelister role for the address.

setTransactionCountLimit(address,uint256.notice: Set transaction count limit for address.

symbol().notice: Returns the symbol of the token.

toggleOpenTransactionCount(bool).notice: Enable or disable the transactions limit.

totalSupply().notice: Returns the amount of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Moves `_amount` tokens from the caller's account to `_recipient`. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Moves `_amount` tokens from `_sender` to `_recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `_amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFunds(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfer funds from one address to another.

unfreezeFunds(address).notice: Unfreeze all funds at the address.
